Key Match Events: Youri Tielemans gave Belgium an early lead with a goal from the edge of the area in the second minute.
Kevin De Bruyne scored Belgium's second goal in the 80th minute after converting direct from Belgium goalkeeper Koen Casteels' long kick.
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin De Bruyne scored and Belgium got its European Championship campaign up and running after beating Romania 2-0 on Saturday, June 22.
Belgium's dominant performance lifted the pressure after the shock of losing to Slovakia in their opening game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Romania's keeper Florin Nita was denied a goal by Dennis Man in the second half.
Romelu Lukaku had a third goal ruled out by VAR at these Euros.
